Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: reserved with painted inscription.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins UCL 386 which has interior decoration preserved. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds above two white bands on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim, and they have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 57)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 719, no. 780)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1818) (phase 2)
